required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Japanese P III vs Voglibose and Placebo
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy of BI 1356 5 mg and 10 mg vs. Placebo for 12 Weeks and vs. Voglibose 0.6 mg for 26 Weeks in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus and Insufficient Glycaemic Control, Followed by an Extension Study to 52 Weeks to Evaluate Long-term Safety

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the current study is to investigate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of Linagliptin (BI 1356) (5 mg or 10 mg / once daily) compared to placebo given for 12 weeks and voglibose for 26 weeks as mono therapy in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus with insufficient glycaemic control. Furthermore, long-term safety is evaluated with an extension treatment to 52 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: Change from the baseline measurement, where the baseline measurement was obtained at randomization (0 week) before receiving study medication

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 26
primary_outcome.description: Change from the baseline measurement, where the baseline measurement was obtained at randomization (0 week) before receiving study medication

primary_outcome.measure: Examination of Long-term Safety of Linagliptin (52-week Treatment)
primary_outcome.description: The incidence of AEs (Preferred Terms) with a frequency of 5% or more in the patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus who received linagliptin (5 mg or 10 mg) once daily for 52 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Efficacy Response of HbA1c at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c value decreased below 7.0%, below 6.5% and reduction from baseline ≥0.5% at Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Efficacy Response of HbA1c at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c value decreased below 7.0%, below 6.5% and reduction from baseline ≥0.5% at Week 26

secondary_outcome.measure: Relative Efficacy Response of HbA1c at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c value decreased below 7.0%, below 6.5% and reduction from baseline ≥0.5% at Week 52

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change from the baseline measurement, where the baseline measurement was obtained at randomization (0 week) before receiving study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 26
secondary_outcome.description: Change from the baseline measurement, where the baseline measurement was obtained at randomization (0 week) before receiving study medication

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Change from the baseline measurement, where the baseline measurement was obtained at randomization (0 week) before receiving study medication

arm_group.arm_group_label: voglibose 0.2 mg three times a day (TID)
arm_group.description: patient to receive a tablet containing 0.2 mg voglibose TID plus 2 placebo tablets matching BI 1356
patient to receive a tablet containing BI 1356 and matching placebo plus 3 placebo tablets matching voglibose
patient to receive 2 tablets containing BI 1356 plus 3 placebo tablets matching voglibose
patient to receive 2 placebo tablets matching BI 1356 plus 3 placebo tablets matching voglibose

intervention.arm_group_label: voglibose 0.2 mg three times a day (TID)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Japanese patients with a diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus. Antidiabetic therapy has to be stable for at least 10 weeks before Visit 1.
2. Glycosylated haemoglobin A1 (HbA1c) 7.0 - 10.0% at Visit 3 (beginning of the 2-week placebo run-in phase)
3. Age: >= 20 and <= 80
4. Body Mass Index (BMI) <= 40 kg/m2
Exclusion criteria:
1. Myocardial infarction, stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 6 months before Visit 1
2. Impaired hepatic function
3. History of severe allergy/hypersensitivity
4. Treatment with anti-diabetic, anti obesity drugs, etc 3 months before Visit 1
5. Fasting blood glucose >240 mg/dl (=13.3 mmol/L) at Visits 2 or 3

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Total 6 groups (including sub-groups in placebo and voglibose groups)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Placebo group has 2 sub-groups, placebo-linagliptin 5mg (from 2nd stage) and placebo-linagliptin 10mg (from 2nd stage). Both Linagliptin 5 mg and 10 mg groups don't have sub-group. Voglibose group has 2 sub-groups, voglibose-linagliptin 5mg (from 3rd stage) and voglibose-linagliptin 10mg (from 3rd stage).

group.title: Placebo - BI1356 (Linagliptin) 5mg - Linagliptin 5mg
group.description: Placebo in Stage 1 - 5 mg in Stage 2 - 5 mg in Stage 3

group.title: Placebo - Linagliptin 5mg - Linagliptin 10mg
group.description: Placebo in Stage 1 - 10 mg in Stage 2 - 10 mg in Stage 3

group.title: Linagliptin 5mg - Linagliptin 5mg - Linagliptin 5mg
group.description: 5 mg in Stage 1 - 5 mg in Stage 2 - 5 mg in Stage 3

group.title: Linagliptin 10 mg - Linagliptin 10 mg - Linagliptin 10 mg
group.description: 10 mg in Stage 1 - 10 mg in Stage 2 - 10 mg in Stage 3

group.title: Voglibose - Voglibose - Linagliptin 5mg
group.description: Voglibose in Stage 1 - Voglibose in Stage 2 - 5 mg in Stage 3

group.title: Voglibose - Voglibose - Linagliptin 10mg
group.description: Voglibose in Stage 1 - Voglibose in Stage 2 - 10 mg in Stage 3

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in HbA1c at Week 12
outcome.description: Change from the baseline measurement, where the baseline measurement was obtained at randomization (0 week) before receiving study medication
outcome.population: For the 12-week analysis, it was planed the comparison between Linagliptin and placebo. Then the patients with voglibose were excluded in this analysis.Full analysis set for 12-week treatment period with Last Observation Carried Forward.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
